overview_of_class: Whether we look at a world-class genius or just a slightly-more-accomplished high school classmate, we can't help wondering what makes some of us so much more successful than others. Were they born special, did they work harder, or were they just luckier? In this course students will explore the state of our knowledge about success, steering clear of self-help gurus and celebrity biographies in favor of insights from research in the cognitive and social sciences. The course's larger purpose is to give students practice in reading, analyzing, and writing about serious ideas with clarity and precision.
name: Writing Seminar II
subject: ENGLISH
